medical_history.chief_complaint: Diffuse abdominal pain with nausea and episodes of watery diarrhea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Flu-like symptoms resolved spontaneously after approximately one week. Developed diffuse abdominal pain 3 days prior to admission, worsening with movement and associated with low-grade fevers up to 100.5Â°F, and shaking chills. Experienced waxing and waning abdominal pain that became especially severe the night before admission. Notably, no bowel movement for the 2 days prior to operation.
medical_history.family_history: Grandmother with gastric problems, other grandmother with breast cancer, two grandparents with diabetes mellitus.
